dialogues.text: Mrs. Cathcart -- 50% Mrs. Biddlecombe -- 50% Mrs. Wentworth -- 50% Mrs. Resnick -- 100%

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "By the light... By the light, by the light... Of the silvery... BIALYSTOCK PICKS HIM UP AND THROWS HIM ACROSS THE BAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me, you drunken bum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairweather friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not true! BIALYSTOCK RUSHES OVER TO BLOOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still mumbling to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way out.  No way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloom, Bloom, maybe it's not true. BLOOM DOES NOT RESPOND.  BIALYSTOCK SHAKES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (droning monotonously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way out.  No way out.  What?  Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we go over to the theatre and see what's really happening? After all, we've only heard from a small portion of the audience. Let's hear what the majority thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a trance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The majority.  The majority.  Yes. Let's hear from the majority. THEY START TO LEAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, we have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making a report)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are falling back on all fronts. Our soldiers are retreating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No good, baby, no good.  You heard my orders.  Nobody retreats. Attack!  Attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who can we attack?  They're all too big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting an inspiration)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, let's stomp Switzerland!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't... we keep our money there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, again with that baby.  There must be no more babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Goebbels?  Where's my little Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the wings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send for Goebbels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the only cat left that still grooves me. GOEBBELS ENTERS LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heil, baby!  I just finished the morning propaganda broadcasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you tell the people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them we invaded England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, baby, that's good!  How'd we come out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groovy! THEY SMACK HANDS. LAUGH FROM AUDIENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring down the curtain!  Bring down the curtain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goebbels, you're the only one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the author of this play.  You are the victims of a hoax.  These are not my words.  The Fuhrer never said baby.  The Fuhrer was sweet, the Fuhrer was kind, the Fuhrer was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that curtain up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!  No!  The curtain must not go up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have been betrayed!  I will return!  I will returnnnnn... LIEBKIND DISAPPEARS INTO THE FLIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We make love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No!  We don't make love.  Go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Congratulations.  It's the biggest hit on Broadway."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Congratulations.  Hitler will run forever."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (boiling with rage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations! HE TEARS TELEGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations! HE TEARS TELEGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations! HE TEARS TELEGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations! HE TEARS TELEGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ecstatic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations!  Have you seen the reviews?  Have you seen the lines at the box office?  It's a torrent, it's an avalanche, it's the biggest hit on Broadway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lousy fruit.  You've ruined me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrieking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!  Help!  He's crazy!  He's going to kill me.  Call the police! Call the police!  Help, help, murder, murder, rape, rape!!! BIALYSTOCK THROWS HIM OUT, SLAMS THE DOOR AND LOCKS IT. FALLS INTO THE CHAIR AND PUTS HIS FEET UP ON THE DESK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moaning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could this happen?  I was so careful.  I picked the wrong play, the wrong director, the wrong cast. Where did I go right?  We forgot one important, Bloom.  Adolf Hitler always drew a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to stop me.  I've made up my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing with those books? Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with hysterical conviction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm turning myself in.  It's the only way.  I'm going to cooperate with the authorities.  They'll reduce my sentence and then there's time off for good behavior.  And maybe I'll get a job in the prison library.  So long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reasonably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo, take it easy.  Relax, you're overwrought.  You don't know what you're doing.  You're acting out of panic... GIMME THOSE BOOKS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never should have listened to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never should have listened to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhhhhhhh, how I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double.  Double.  Double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching the books triumphantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haaaaa!  Haaaaa!  Haaaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrieking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off screen, outside door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am betrayed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solemnly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have broken the Siegfried Oath. You must die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no good.  I'm not killing you.  Don't you understand, you have broken the Siegfried Oath. You must die.  Vill you cooperate!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.  Come in. ULLA ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear noise.  You call? SHE LOOKS AROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh.  I see you.  You like something?  Coffee? BIALYSTOCK AND BLOOM LOOK AT EACH OTHER IN DISBELIEF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee.  Yes.  That's a good idea. (with great emphasis)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask the gentleman with the gun... The gentleman who is shooting at us... and trying to kill us... what he will have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Liebkind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please.  Black.  Two sugars. ULLA REPEATS TO HERSELF AS SHE STARTS FOR THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three coffees.  Two regular.  One black... two sugars. SHE EXITS AND CLOSES THE DOOR BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now ve must resume hostilities. Are you coming out from behind that desk or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowards, miserable cringing cowards. Clinging to life like baby butterflies.  Vatch, vatch and remember.  Franz Liebkind vill show you how to die like a man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhalted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon I vill be vit mine Fuhrer, und Goering, und Goebbels, and Himmler. I'm coming boys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in utter anguish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, vhen things go wrong! HE FALLS INTO A CHAIR AND SOBS LIKE A CHILD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a failure.  I'm a failure.  I'm a failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five o'clock.  Killed a whole day playing hide-and-seek with a crazy Kraut. BIALYSTOCK PICKS UP LUGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still sobbing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not crazy.  I'm inept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vhere?  Vhere?... oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Liebkind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy lunatic!  What are you shooting at us for?  Why don't you use this (indicates gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where it will do us some good?  Why don't you shoot the actors? (the thought strikes home)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liebkind, have I ever steered you wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.  Listen.  Every night people are laughing at your beloved Fuhrer.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that LSD und his verdampter babies!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him the gun and some money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Buy bullets.  Kill.  Kill them all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bloom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  The actors.  I must destroy the actors. LIEBKIND STARTS TO GO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  Stop!  This is insanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind?  What are you talking about?  Kill the actors. You can't kill the actors -- they're not animals, they're human beings!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are?  Have you ever eaten with one?  Liebkind, go!  Kill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liebkind, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bloom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  We're trapped. It's either the show or us.  There's no way out.  What can we do, blow up the theatre? BIALYSTOCK FREEZES AS THE THOUGHT TAKES HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the surgeon at work)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuse cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. LIEBKIND TIES FUSE IN PLACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gut.  Now for the master connection. CAMERA FOLLOWS THEM AS THEY MOVE BACK THROUGH THE TUNNEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gut.  Now vhere's the other fuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bloom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick it up and bring it here, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. HE STARTS TOWARD SECOND TUNNEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going vit the light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need it.  How'm I gonna find the fuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, ve come vit you.  All for one and all in the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now ve take the two fuse leads, attach them to the terminals of the conductor and ve're in business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean out of business.  Heh, heh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated.  He has not time for small talk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I... Well, it's just that... I'm sorry I called you fat, fat, fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smacking Bloom affectionately on the shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh.  Leo, Leo, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus to minus.  Negative to positive. Male to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Let's get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qviet.  Qviet  This is very important. HE TURNS BACK TO HIS WORK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vait a minute.  Vait a minute. Male to male?  Male to female? Female to male?  Female to female? Vait a minute.  In people, male to female.  But electricity is strange. It's male to male. HE QUICKLY FINISHES THE CONNECTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sehr gut. (to Bialystock)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow fuse, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. HE BEGINS TYING SLOW FUSE TO CONDUCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he works)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now ve take the slow fuse.  Tie one end to the master connection and the other ve attach to the detonator. HE FINISHES CONNECTIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, ve go to the detonator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vait a minute.  Are you sure this is slow fuse?  It feels like qvick fuse. (to Bloom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shine your light on it. BLOOM SHINES LIGHT ON FUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I don't know.  The markings are so similar.  Qvick fuse or slow fuse? LIEBKIND TAKES A WOODEN MATCH OUT OF HIS POCKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must find out.  It is critical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's face it.  That was dumb. HE TROTS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, vhere is you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dot vas the qvick one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We assumed that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  You see.  This is the slow fuse.  It is much wider.  It has more resistance, more density. Therefore, it burns slower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you had the slow fuse in your pocket all the time and you forgot to put it on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Amazing isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid kraut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vhy do you always call me kraut? Kraut is cabbage!  Do ve call you hot dogs?  Ve call you Yanks not franks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Finish the job.  Let's get outta here. CUT TO SIDE DOOR OF THEATRE.  THE DOOR OPENS SLOWLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Und now for the final connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  I'll check to see if the coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coast is clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, my foolish fancy.  Goodbye, my misbegotten child.  Goodbye, my tortured testament of twisted truths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!  Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.  I can't do it.  It's a demon.  It's a gargoyle, it's a monster... but it's still my child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quizzically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is gut... of course, of course. In electricity, it's always male to female.  But with people, it's not always so.  Come ve must go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I need you.  It's dark in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.  Let's not waste time. THEY OPEN THE SIDE DOOR AND DISAPPEAR INTO THE THEATRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off camera, singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Honeymoon, keep a shinin' in June,"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "your silvery beams, Will light love's dreams,"  What the heck is that?  A bicycle pump? Naaah.  Lemme see.  Could it be? Good grief, it's Eli Whitney's cotton gin... Naaah.  Aahh, I know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shine 'em up! HE PUSHES PLUNGER DOWN WITH HIS FOOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bravely singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sa-an Fra-ancisco, open your golden gates, Don't let a stranger wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling through his bandages)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Male to male?  Male to female? CUT TO TIGHT SHOT OF JUDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has the jury reached a verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have, your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does the jury find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find the defendants incredibly guilty. CUT TO JUDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will the defendants please rise and approach the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the defendants have anything to say in their behalf before the court pronounces sentence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to say a word, sir, not on my behalf, but in behalf of my partner, Max Bialystock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, your honor.  Max Bialystock is a very selfish man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Bloom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a liar and a cheat and a scoundrel.  He's taken money from little old ladies.  He's talked people into doing things they never would have dreamed of.  Especially me.  But who has he really hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are the victims?  Not me, I had the most exciting adventure of my life.  And what about the little old ladies?  What would their lives have been without Max Bialystock? He made them feel wanted and young and attractive again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off camera, ad-lib)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh, Max, Max, I love you Max." "Let him go, let him go." "Don't take my Bialy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapping gavel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order.  Order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And may I humbly add, your honor, that we have learned our lesson and we'll never do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take that into consideration. The defendants shall serve not more than five and not less than two years in the State Penitentiary. (he pounds gavel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WORLD PREMIERE 979344 and 979345

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "PRISONERS OF LOVE" STARRING 778629 and CO-STARRING 440123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five dollars.  Here's your receipt.  You now own 28% of "Prisoners of Love."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving his cane and shouting at the top of his lungs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Higher, you animals, higher!  We open Saturday night!  Kick!  Kick! Two-three-kick-turn!  Two-three- kick-turn!  Okay, let's hear it! THE PRISONERS BREAK INTO SONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We're prisoners of love, etc." MUSIC SWELLS TO CRESCENDO.
